titleStmt.title: Memoires of the life and actions of the most invincible and triumphant prince, Ihon the Great, third of that name, present king of Poland containing a succinct series of affairs from craddle to his present day : with a particular relation of his many great and stupendious victories obtain'd against the Turks and Tartars, from the time he was first made crown-general, and afterwards elected King of Poland / done in verse, out of H. G's historical account of the said princes life and actions, by a lover of the peace and glory of Christendome.
titleStmt.author: Tyler, Alexander.
H. G. Scanderbeg rediviuus.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the Heir of Andrew Anderson ...,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: his "Signal dangers and deliverances ..." and "The tempest, between Burnt-island and Luth ..." [7, 8, [7] p.] are lacking in filmed copy.
Reproduction of original in Edinburgh University Library.
